ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.2_0: At that time the nun Caṇḍakāḷī was quarreling, arguing, and creating legal issues in the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.3_0: But when a legal procedure was being done against her, the nun Thullanandā objected.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.4_0: Soon afterwards when Thullanandā went to a village on some business,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.6_0: took the opportunity to eject Caṇḍakāḷī for not recognizing an offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.7_0: When Thullanandā had finished her business in that village, she returned to Sāvatthī.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.8_0: On her return, Caṇḍakāḷī neither prepared a seat for her, nor set out a foot-stool, a foot-scraper, or water for washing the feet; and she did not go out to meet her to receive her bowl and robe, nor ask whether she wanted water to drink.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.10_0: why she was acting like this.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.11_0: She replied, “That’s how it is, Venerable, when you don’t have a protector.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.12_0: “But how is it, Venerable, that you don’t have a protector?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.14_0: that no-one would speak up for me because I am not esteemed by them and I didn’t have a protector, they ejected me for not recognizing an offense.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.15_0: Because they had done the robe-making procedure, the nun Thullanandā
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.16_0: “There is no choice that I haven’t done such deeds, whether or not this is to be done.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.17_0: But we too know that a deed is (neither) deeds, and our enemy.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.18_0: We can get legal procedures done that haven’t been done, and we can get procedures that have been done overturned.” And she quickly gathered a sangha of nuns and reinstated the nun Caṇḍakāḷī.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.19_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.20_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā reinstate a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group?” ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.21_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.24_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā reinstate a nun who had been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule, the Monastic Law, and the Teacher’s instruction, without first getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.26_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:1.27.1_0: ‘If a nun, without getting permission from the Sangha that did the legal procedure and without the consent of the group, reinstates a nun who has been ejected by a unanimous Sangha in accordance with the rule and the Monastic Law and the Teacher’s instruction, then that nun too has committed an immediate offense entailing sending away and suspension.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.

ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.10_0: in accordance with that rule, in accordance with that Monastic Law.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.12_0: in accordance with the Conqueror’s instruction, in accordance with the Buddha’s instruction.

ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.17_0: If, intending to reinstate her, she searches for a group or establishes a monastic boundary, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-ss4:2.1.18_0: For a procedure that requires one motion and two announcements, he commits a serious offense.
